meanings.sent1: The narks provided valuable information to the police.
meanings.sent2: The undercover narks uncovered the criminal organization.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky narks always knew what was happening before anyone else.
meanings.sent4: She was like a silent narks, observing everything without being noticed.

meanings.sent1: The loud music narks the neighbors every night.
meanings.sent2: Her constant tapping on the desk narks her classmates during exams.
meanings.sent3: The buzzing mosquito narks everyone trying to sleep.
meanings.sent4: The dripping faucet narks like a persistent reminder of a task left undone.
meanings.sent5: The scratchy tag on his shirt narks him all day long.

meanings.sent1: She always narks about the long lines at the grocery store.
meanings.sent2: He narks about the poor service at the restaurant every time we go.
meanings.sent3: The grumpy customer narks about everything on the menu.
meanings.sent4: The old man narks about the weather no matter what it's like.
meanings.sent5: She narks so much that no one wants to listen anymore.

meanings.definition: A feeling of annoyance or irritation
meanings.sent1: The constant noise outside gave her a narks.
meanings.sent2: His persistent tapping on the table gave her a narks.

meanings.sent4: The never-ending traffic jam was a narks to all the drivers.
